briefdescription.para: Conventional cache line size used for distance heuristics (bytes).
Initialize policy with detected cache sizes and sane defaults.

detaileddescription.para: The function attempts to read cache sizes from Linux sysfs and then applies internal heuristics to set prefetch_distance and nt_threshold_bytes. Environment variables listed in the file header override the computed values.

p
Non-null policy to be initialized.
0 on success; negative value on error (e.g., invalid pointer).
Initialize policy with detected cache sizes and sane defaults.

Cache detection is best-effort (Linux sysfs). If detection fails, conservative defaults are used:
L1D: 32 KiB
L2: 1 MiB
L3: 8 MiB

Defaults:
prefetch_distance: 6 cache lines
nt_threshold_bytes: 2x LLC

Env overrides:
IE_STREAM_PREFETCH
IE_STREAM_NT_THRESHOLD
IE_STREAM_FORCE_NT

simplesect.para: 0 on success, or -EINVAL on invalid arguments.

briefdescription.para: Decide if non-temporal stores should be used for a given transfer size.

detaileddescription.para: The decision observes force_nt_on and force_nt_off first; otherwise it compares bytes with nt_threshold_bytes.

bytes
Total transfer size in bytes.
p
Non-null policy pointer.
true if non-temporal stores are recommended.
Decide if non-temporal stores should be used for a given transfer size.
The decision uses the policy threshold unless forced on/off via IE_STREAM_FORCE_NT.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the memory operation in bytes.

simplesect.para: true if non-temporal stores are recommended, else false.

briefdescription.para: Recommend a prefetch distance in bytes for the given stride.

detaileddescription.para: The recommendation considers the policy prefetch distance, stride size, and attempts to keep the lead within a few cache lines.

p
Non-null policy pointer.
stride_bytes
Positive stride size in bytes.
Distance in bytes to pass to the prefetch helpers.
Recommend a prefetch distance in bytes for the given stride.

This clamps the configured distance to a practical range:
at least one cache line,
at most half of L1,
at least stride_bytes when stride_bytes is provided.

parameterdescription.para: Access stride in bytes (0 => assume cacheline stride).

simplesect.para: Recommended prefetch lead distance in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Issue a T0 (cache-hot) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.

detaileddescription.para:
base
Base address (non-null).
distance
Lead distance in bytes (can be zero).
Issue a T0 (cache-hot) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.
On non-x86 builds this function is a no-op.

parameterdescription.para: Byte offset from base to prefetch.

briefdescription.para: Issue a non-temporal (NTA) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.

detaileddescription.para:
base
Base address (non-null).
distance
Lead distance in bytes (can be zero).
Issue a non-temporal (NTA) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.
On non-x86 builds this function is a no-op.

parameterdescription.para: Byte offset from base to prefetch.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *base, size_t bytes, size_t stride, size_t distance)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_prefetch_range_t0

briefdescription.para: Prefetch a range using T0 hint at a given stride and lead distance.

detaileddescription.para:
base
Range base (non-null).
bytes
Range size in bytes.
stride
Step in bytes between prefetches (>= IE_CACHELINE_BYTES recommended).
distance
Lead distance in bytes (see ie_stream_recommend_prefetch_distance).
Prefetch a range using T0 hint at a given stride and lead distance.
Walks the byte range [base, base+bytes) and issues prefetches at (current + distance), stepping by stride (or cacheline if stride==0).

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *base, size_t bytes, size_t stride, size_t distance)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_prefetch_range_nta

briefdescription.para: Prefetch a range using NTA hint at a given stride and lead distance.

detaileddescription.para:
base
Range base (non-null).
bytes
Range size in bytes.
stride
Step in bytes between prefetches.
distance
Lead distance in bytes.
Prefetch a range using NTA hint at a given stride and lead distance.
Walks the byte range [base, base+bytes) and issues prefetches at (current + distance), stepping by stride (or cacheline if stride==0).

memberdef.argsstring: (float *dst, const float *src, size_t n, const struct ie_stream_policy *p, double nt_ratio)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_copy_f32

briefdescription.para: Copy n floats from src to dst using optional non-temporal stores.

detaileddescription.para: If ie_stream_should_use_nt decides for streaming, the function uses wide non-temporal stores when available (AVX2/AVX-512). The nt_ratio allows mixing regular and streaming stores (e.g., 0.5 means half of the bulk uses streaming). For small tails or when features are unavailable, a scalar fallback is used.

dst
Destination pointer (non-null).
src
Source pointer (non-null).
n
Number of float elements to copy.
p
Non-null policy pointer.
nt_ratio
Fraction in [0,1]; 0=never stream, 1=always stream (when allowed).
Copy n floats from src to dst using optional non-temporal stores.

The function uses policy thresholds plus nt_ratio to decide whether to use non-temporal streaming stores. If nt_ratio is 0, the function forces a scalar copy even if the policy would otherwise stream.

parameterdescription.para: Ratio in [0,1]; 0 disables NT, >0 enables if policy allows.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *dst, float value, size_t n, const struct ie_stream_policy *p, double nt_ratio)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_memset_f32

briefdescription.para: Set n floats at dst to value using optional non-temporal stores.

detaileddescription.para:
dst
Destination pointer (non-null).
value
Value to set.
n
Number of float elements to set.
p
Non-null policy pointer.
nt_ratio
Fraction in [0,1] controlling the mix of streaming stores.
Set n floats at dst to value using optional non-temporal stores.
The function uses policy thresholds plus nt_ratio to decide whether to use non-temporal streaming stores. If nt_ratio is 0, the function forces a scalar set even if the policy would otherwise stream.

parameterdescription.para: Ratio in [0,1]; 0 disables NT, >0 enables if policy allows.

briefdescription.para: Portable wrappers for controlled prefetching and non-temporal (streaming) stores.

detaileddescription.para:
This header provides:
Thin wrappers around _mm_prefetch with cache-level hints.
Heuristics for choosing prefetch distances and when to use non-temporal stores.
High-level streaming copy/set helpers that mix regular and streaming stores via a ratio.

Design notes (safety & portability):
All intrinsics are guarded by architecture macros. On non-x86 or when a feature is unavailable at compile time, safe scalar fallbacks are used.
Streaming stores require attention to alignment for best results. The helpers handle a small scalar "prologue/epilogue" to avoid alignment faults and still benefit from wide stores on the bulk region when available.
Prefetching uses byte distances relative to the base pointer. Distances should be chosen as multiples of the cache line size (commonly 64 bytes on x86).

Environment variables (optional):
IE_STREAM_PREFETCH=<bytes> : override recommended prefetch distance.
IE_STREAM_NT_THRESHOLD=<bytes> : size threshold above which non-temporal stores are preferred.
IE_STREAM_FORCE_NT=0/1 : force-disable or force-enable streaming stores.
